thread.title: More illegal Vietnamese immigrants expelled from Cambodia | Khmer
thread.title_full: More illegal Vietnamese immigrants expelled from Cambodia | Khmer Times | News Portal Cambodia |

author: Xinhua
title: More illegal Vietnamese immigrants expelled from Cambodia | Khmer
text:
PHNOM PENH, (Xinhua) -- Cambodia deported another group of 42 Vietnamese, including 3 females, to their birth country on Saturday because they had lived and worked in Cambodia illegally, a senior police official said.
Major General Ouk Hai Seila, chief of the General Department of Immigration's (GDI) investigation and procedure department, said the Vietnamese were repatriated to their country through the Bavet International Border Checkpoint.
"They had been arrested and deported after we found that they had lived and worked in Cambodia without passports," he said.
According to the GDI, Cambodia had expelled approximately 3,226 illegal foreigners, 87 percent of them are Vietnamese, from April 2014 to September 2015.
Under the kingdom's immigration law, any alien living in the country without valid documents such as passports, visas, or work permits are subject to expulsion.
